attributes.action: Opposition to table a Motion of No Confidence in His Majesty’s Government
attributes.additional_details: This government has lost the confidence of the people through it’s bad management of the illegal migration situation in the country and has put the rights of the illegal migrants above the rights of the British population. Under the conventions of our constitution, it is the duty of Parliament to test whether the Prime Minister still commands a majority in the House of Commons.
attributes.background: We urge the Leader of the Opposition, and all opposition parties, to exercise their constitutional responsibility by calling a vote of no confidence at the earliest opportunity.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for a vote of no confidence in the Government. This is set out in the Committee's standards: https://petition.parliament.uk/help

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.

You might like to sign this petition:

Call an immediate general election
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727309
